Description: Rim and body sherd of Chian pottery plate or shallow bowl; thick white slip; interior reserved save for band on top of plain rim and three lines on mid-wall; exterior reserved.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Lemos takes the vessel as a Chalice Style phiale, but the interior surface of the vessel is not consistent with other phialai from this series. Nor is the thickness and the general shape - this is obviously a plate. For parallels regarding the slip and pattern, see British Museum 1965,0930.477.
For parallels regarding the lack of black slip on the interior surface of Chian pottery, see Bonn 697.9.
Bibliographic references: Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 100, no. 305.1, pl. XXXII)
Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 307, no. 1231, pl. 160)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2155) (phase 2)
Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 212, no. 18)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.5948 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
